Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Given the county’s long history of white flight and segregation, its oldest neighborhoods are primarily — other than Midtown — occupied by Black and brown residents. In South Memphis, for instance, about 96% of residents are Black, and about 91% of homes were built prior to 1978, according to the U.S. Census Bureau.
Document Sources.Source Justification: according to the U.S. Census Bureau

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: The map below shows which Memphis ZIPs contain the most homes built before 1980, according to Census data.
To find out if your individual home was built before 1978, check Realtor.com or the Shelby County Assessor of Property website.
Document Sources.Name of Source: Shelby County Assessor of Property website
Document Sources.Source Justification: check Realtor.com or the Shelby County Assessor of Property website

Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Jacob Steimer is the housing and development reporter for MLK50: Justice Through Journalism
